title: TC001-User Registration with Valid Data
description: Verify that a new user can register successfully with valid personal and business information, and is assigned USER role by default.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the 'Kayƒ±t Ol' link to go to the registration page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Kayƒ±t Ol' link to navigate to the registration page.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/nav/div/div/div[2]/a[4]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Fill in the registration form with valid personal and business information.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Fill in the 'Ad Soyad' (Name) field with valid name.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Test User')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Fill in the 'Email Adresi' (Email) field with valid email.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('e2xldigital@gmail.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Fill in the '≈ûifre' (Password) field with valid password.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123456')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Fill in the 'Telefon' (Phone) field with valid phone number.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('+905551234567')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Fill in the 'ƒ∞≈ületme Adƒ±' (Business Name) field with valid business name.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[5]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Test Business')
        

        # -> Click the 'Hesap Olu≈ütur' button to submit the registration form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Hesap Olu≈ütur' button to submit the registration form.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Clear the email field and input a new unique email address to retry registration.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Clear the 'Email Adresi' field to input a new unique email.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        

        # -> Input a new unique email address into the email field.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input a new unique email address to retry registration.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('uniqueuser12345@example.com')
        

        # -> Click the 'Hesap Olu≈ütur' button to submit the registration form with the new unique email.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Hesap Olu≈ütur' button to submit the registration form with new unique email.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Log in with the newly registered user credentials to verify successful registration and USER role assignment.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input the registered email to login.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('uniqueuser12345@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input the password to login.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123456')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Giri≈ü Yap' button to log in.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Check user profile or account settings to verify the assigned USER role.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Panel' link to access user panel or profile settings to verify user role.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/nav/div/div/div[2]/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Ho≈ü geldiniz, Test User! üëã').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Kullanƒ±cƒ± Panel').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Aktif deneme bulunmuyor').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Aktif abonelik bulunmuyor').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC005-Role-Based Access Control for Admin and User
description: Verify access restrictions: Admin can access admin panel, Users cannot; Users can access user dashboard, Admins can also access user areas.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the 'Giri≈ü' (Login) link to start Admin login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Giri≈ü' (Login) link to open login form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/nav/div/div/div[2]/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input Admin email and password, then click login button
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input Admin email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('e2xldigital@gmail.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input Admin password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123456')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click login button to submit Admin credentials
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on the 'Y√∂netim Paneline Git' (Go to Admin Panel) link to verify Admin access to admin panel
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Y√∂netim Paneline Git' link to access admin panel
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Report the runtime error issue blocking admin panel access and then proceed to login as User role to verify user dashboard access and admin panel restriction.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Giri≈ü' (Login) link to log out and prepare for User role login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=div[2]/div[2]/div/div/nav/small[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Log out Admin user and navigate to login page to perform User role login
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Giri≈ü' (Login) link to log out Admin and prepare for User login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/header/nav/div[2]/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Try to find an alternative way to log out Admin user or navigate to login page for User role login to continue access restriction verification.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/logout', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/login', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Access Denied: Admin Panel Restricted').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Access restrictions verification failed. Admin should access admin panel and user dashboard; Users should access user dashboard but be denied admin panel access.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on the link or button to navigate to the product catalog page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Sistemleri Ke≈üfet' to navigate to the product catalog page.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/section/div[2]/div/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Select a product category filter, for example 'Restoran' category.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Restoran' category filter to filter products by this category.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div[2]/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Restoran Otomasyon').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=ƒ∞≈ületmenize uygun otomasyon sistemini se√ßin ve verimliliƒüinizi artƒ±rƒ±n').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Garson Sipari≈ü & Masa Takip Sistemi').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Garsonlarƒ±n sipari≈üleri hƒ±zlƒ±ca alƒ±p mutfaƒüa ilettiƒüi, masa durumlarƒ±nƒ± takip ettiƒüi sistem').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=7 g√ºn √ºcretsiz deneme').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Giri≈ü' (Login) to access the login page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Giri≈ü' (Login) link to go to login page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/nav/div/div/div[2]/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input email and password, then click the login button to authenticate.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input email address for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('e2xldigital@gmail.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123456')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the login button to submit credentials
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Simulate PayTR payment success callback with correct parameters.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/api/paytr/callback?status=success&order_id=12345&amount=1000&currency=TRY&transaction_id=abc123&hash=validhash', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Navigate to the user dashboard or payment records page to verify the payment status update.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:3001/dashboard', timeout=10000)
        await asyncio.sleep(3)
        

        # -> Navigate to the 'Faturalama' (Billing) page to check detailed payment records and subscription statuses for further verification.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Faturalama' (Billing) to check payment and subscription details
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/aside/nav/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Payment Failed: Callback Not Processed').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Payment callback execution did not update payment and subscription statuses as expected. The payment success callback simulation did not reflect the correct status updates on the dashboard or billing page.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click on 'Giri≈ü' (Login) to start admin login process.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Giri≈ü' (Login) to open login page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/nav/div/div/div[2]/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Input admin email and password, then click 'Giri≈ü Yap' to login.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin email
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('e2xldigital@gmail.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input admin password
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123456')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Giri≈ü Yap' button to login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on 'Y√∂netim' or 'Y√∂netim Paneline Git' to navigate to product management.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Y√∂netim Paneline Git' to go to management panel
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Product Addition Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Admin product management test did not complete successfully. The expected confirmation 'Product Addition Successful' was not found, indicating failure in adding, editing, deleting products or managing trials as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

description: Verify the floating WhatsApp support button is visible on all pages, with dynamic messaging reflecting current page context.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click the WhatsApp button on the landing page to verify it opens WhatsApp with the correct dynamic message and phone number.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the floating WhatsApp support button on the landing page
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Support Ticket Resolved Successfully').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The floating WhatsApp support button is not visible on all pages or does not open WhatsApp with the correct dynamic message and phone number as required by the test plan.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:3001", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:

        except async_api.Error:

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow

        # -> Input email and password, then click login button to access the system.

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input password for login
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123456')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the login button to submit credentials
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/main/div/div/div[2]/form/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Navigate to 'Fiyatlandƒ±rma' (Pricing) or 'Denemelerim' (My Trials) to find utilities or test areas for currency, date, and remaining days calculations.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Fiyatlandƒ±rma' (Pricing) to access currency formatting and related utilities.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/nav/div/div/div[2]/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Navigate to 'Panel' or 'Denemelerim' section to find date formatting and remaining days calculation utilities or test areas.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Panel' to access dashboard or user area where date and remaining days utilities might be available.
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/nav/div/div/div[2]/a[4]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Currency conversion successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError("Test case failed: Utility functions for currency formatting, date formatting, and remaining days calculation did not produce expected results as per the test plan.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
